action.action-desc: Ms. Lofgren (for herself, Mr. Sensenbrenner, Mr. Polis, Mr. Lipinski, Mr. Michael F. Doyle of Pennsylvania, and Mr. O’Rourke) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to provide for clarification as to the meaning of access without authorization, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Aaron's Law Act of 2015.

section.header: Clarifying that access without authorization under section 1030 of title 18, United States Code, means circumvention of technological barriers in order to gain unauthorized access

subsection.text: Section 1030(e)(6) of title 18, United States Code, is amended by—

paragraph.text: striking exceeds authorized access and all that follows; and
inserting the following: “‘access without authorization’ means—

subparagraph.text: to obtain information on a protected computer;
that the accesser lacks authorization to obtain; and
by knowingly circumventing one or more technological or physical measures that are designed to exclude or prevent unauthorized individuals from obtaining that information;

subsection.text: Section 1030 of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (d)(10), by striking unauthorized access, or exceeding authorized access, to a and inserting access without authorization of a protected; and
by striking exceeds authorized access each place it appears.

subsection.text: Section 1030(a) of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (5), (6), and (7) as paragraphs (4), (5), and (6), respectively.

subsection.text: Section 1030 of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (2), by striking (a)(6) each place it appears and inserting (a)(5); and

clause.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking subsection (a)(4) or (a)(7) and inserting subsection (a)(6); and
in subparagraph (B), by striking subsection (a)(4), or (a)(7) and inserting subsection (a)(6); and
in subparagraph (A)(i), in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking subsection (a)(5)(B) and inserting subsection (a)(4)(B);
in subparagraph (B)(i), by striking subsection (a)(5)(A) and inserting subsection (a)(4)(A);
in subparagraph (C)(i), by striking subsection (a)(5) and inserting subsection (a)(4);
in subparagraph (D)(i), by striking subsection (a)(5)(C) and inserting subsection (a)(4)(C);
in subparagraph (E), by striking subsection (a)(5)(A) and inserting subsection (a)(4)(A);
in subparagraph (F), by striking subsection (a)(5)(A) and inserting subsection (a)(4)(A); and
in subparagraph (G)(i), by striking subsection (a)(5) and inserting subsection (a)(4); and

paragraph.text: in subsection (h), by striking subsection (a)(5) and inserting subsection (a)(4).

subsection.text: Section 1030(c)(2) of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking conviction for another and inserting subsequent; and
by inserting such after attempt to commit;

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (B)(i), by inserting after financial gain the following: and the fair market value of the information obtained exceeds $5,000;

in subparagraph (B)(ii), by striking the offense was committed and all that follows through the semicolon, and inserting the following: the offense was committed in furtherance of any criminal act in violation of the Constitution or laws of the United States or of any State punishable by a term of imprisonment greater than one year, unless such criminal acts are prohibited by this section or such State violation would be based solely on accessing information without authorization;;
in subparagraph (B)(iii), by inserting fair market before value; and

subparagraph.text: by striking conviction for another and inserting subsequent; and
by inserting such after attempt to commit.
